00001 /**********************************************************************
00002 * $Id$          uart_polling_test.c                             2010-05-21
00003 */
00025 #include "lpc17xx_uart.h"
00026 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00027 #include "lpc17xx_pinsel.h"
00028 
00029 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00035 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS *************************/
00036 #define UART_PORT 0
00037 
00038 #if (UART_PORT == 0)
00039 #define TEST_UART LPC_UART0
00040 #elif (UART_PORT == 1)
00041 #define TEST_UART (LPC_UART_TypeDef *)UART1
00042 #endif
00043 
00044 
00045 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00046 uint8_t menu1[] = "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r";
00047 uint8_t menu2[] = "UART polling mode demo \n\r\t MCU LPC17xx - ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r\t UART0 - 9600bps \n\r";
00048 uint8_t menu3[] = "UART demo terminated!";
00049 
00050 /************************** PRIVATE FUNCTIONS *************************/
00051 void print_menu(void);
00052 
00053 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00054 /*********************************************************************/
00059 void print_menu(void)
00060 {
00061         UART_Send(TEST_UART, menu1, sizeof(menu1), BLOCKING);
00062         UART_Send(TEST_UART, menu2, sizeof(menu2), BLOCKING);
00063 }
00064 
00065 
00066 
00067 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00068 /*********************************************************************/
00073 int c_entry(void)
00074 {
00075         // UART Configuration structure variable
00076         UART_CFG_Type UARTConfigStruct;
00077         // UART FIFO configuration Struct variable
00078         UART_FIFO_CFG_Type UARTFIFOConfigStruct;
00079         // Pin configuration for UART0
00080         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00081 
00082         uint32_t idx, len;
00083         __IO FlagStatus exitflag;
00084         uint8_t buffer[10];
00085 
00086 #if (UART_PORT == 0)
00087         /*
00088          * Initialize UART0 pin connect
00089          */
00090         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00091         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00092         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00093         PinCfg.Pinnum = 2;
00094         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00095         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00096         PinCfg.Pinnum = 3;
00097         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00098 #endif
00099 
00100 #if (UART_PORT == 1)
00101         /*
00102          * Initialize UART1 pin connect
00103          */
00104         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00105         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00106         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00107         PinCfg.Pinnum = 0;
00108         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00109         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00110         PinCfg.Pinnum = 1;
00111         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00112 #endif
00113 
00114         /* Initialize UART Configuration parameter structure to default state:
00115          * Baudrate = 9600bps
00116          * 8 data bit
00117          * 1 Stop bit
00118          * None parity
00119          */
00120         UART_ConfigStructInit(&UARTConfigStruct);
00121 
00122         // Initialize UART0 peripheral with given to corresponding parameter
00123         UART_Init(TEST_UART, &UARTConfigStruct);
00124 
00125         /* Initialize FIFOConfigStruct to default state:
00126          *                              - FIFO_DMAMode = DISABLE
00127          *                              - FIFO_Level = UART_FIFO_TRGLEV0
00128          *                              - FIFO_ResetRxBuf = ENABLE
00129          *                              - FIFO_ResetTxBuf = ENABLE
00130          *                              - FIFO_State = ENABLE
00131          */
00132         UART_FIFOConfigStructInit(&UARTFIFOConfigStruct);
00133 
00134         // Initialize FIFO for UART0 peripheral
00135         UART_FIFOConfig(TEST_UART, &UARTFIFOConfigStruct);
00136 
00137 
00138         // Enable UART Transmit
00139         UART_TxCmd(TEST_UART, ENABLE);
00140 
00141         // print welcome screen
00142         print_menu();
00143 
00144         // Reset exit flag
00145         exitflag = RESET;
00146 
00147     /* Read some data from the buffer */
00148     while (exitflag == RESET)
00149     {
00150        len = 0;
00151         while (len == 0)
00152         {
00153             len = UART_Receive(TEST_UART, buffer, sizeof(buffer), NONE_BLOCKING);
00154         }
00155 
00156         /* Got some data */
00157         idx = 0;
00158         while (idx < len)
00159         {
00160             if (buffer[idx] == 27)
00161             {
00162                 /* ESC key, set exit flag */
00163                 UART_Send(TEST_UART, menu3, sizeof(menu3), BLOCKING);
00164                 exitflag = SET;
00165             }
00166             else if (buffer[idx] == 'r')
00167             {
00168                 print_menu();
00169             }
00170             else
00171             {
00172                 /* Echo it back */
00173                 UART_Send(TEST_UART, &buffer[idx], 1, BLOCKING);
00174             }
00175             idx++;
00176         }
00177     }
00178 
00179     // wait for current transmission complete - THR must be empty
00180     while (UART_CheckBusy(TEST_UART) == SET);
00181 
00182     // DeInitialize UART0 peripheral
00183     UART_DeInit(TEST_UART);
00184 
00185     /* Loop forever */
00186     while(1);
00187     return 1;
00188 }
00189 
00190 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00191    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00192    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00193    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00194    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00195 int main(void)
00196 {
00197     return c_entry();
00198 }

00206 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00207 * @return               None
00208 *******************************************************************************/
00209 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00210 {
00211         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00212          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */

00216 }
